TEXT: CARDINAL . ORG On DATE Miss PERSON started working as an auxiliary shorthand typist for ORG ( département of ORG ) . She was appointed as a trainee on DATE and given a permanent post on CARDINAL March DATE .
CARDINAL . ORG In a decision of CARDINAL DATE the mayor of GPE ( " the mayor " ) granted a request by the applicant for DATE leave of absence for personal reasons from DATE .
CARDINAL . ORG Miss PERSON applied for reinstatement with effect from DATE . On CARDINAL DATE she was informed that her application had been refused by the mayor .
On DATE she sought renewal of her leave of absence for DATE . The mayor granted her application in a decision of CARDINAL DATE .
CARDINAL . ORG On DATE Miss PERSON applied for reinstatement on DATE . The mayor replied on DATE as follows :

As you are aware , reinstatement as of right is by way of appointment to one of the first CARDINAL posts falling vacant where the leave of absence has not exceeded DATE . The essential requirement , however , is that there should be a vacancy . As the posts of shorthand typist provided for in our establishment table are filled by permanent staff , it is not possible to reinstate you at present .
If the situation remains unchanged on DATE , you will be technically reinstated and will be on leave of absence without pay until another solution is found .

CARDINAL . ORG On DATE Miss PERSON reapplied to the mayor for reinstatement . She argued that the regulations did not authorise him to " technically reinstate " her or to grant her a further DATE ’s leave of absence .
CARDINAL . ORG On DATE the mayor ordered that Miss PERSON be " technically " reinstated and continue to be " on leave of absence without pay " .
CARDINAL . ORG On DATE the applicant wrote to the mayor challenging the lawfulness of the measure taken and requesting her reinstatement and payment in full of her salary from DATE .

The mayor replied on DATE that reinstatement as of right was by way of appointment to CARDINAL of the first CARDINAL posts falling vacant and that in this instance CARDINAL appointments had been made to the same grade as the applicant .
In a letter of DATE Miss PERSON disputed the information given by the mayor . On DATE she made a further application for reinstatement .
On DATE the mayor told the applicant that if she considered her situation ( which , he said , was still the same ) unlawful , it was open to her to apply to the administrative court .
CARDINAL . On DATE Miss PERSON applied for reinstatement on DATE . On CARDINAL March CARDINAL the mayor notified her of his refusal .
CARDINAL . ORG On DATE the applicant sent the mayor the following letter :
Pursuant to your decision of DATE , you ‘ ORG reinstated me and you are aware that this situation is unlawful .
I therefore request
CARDINAL . my actual reinstatement ; and

CARDINAL . compensation in an amount corresponding to the salary I should have received since DATE . If you refuse my request , I shall bring proceedings in the administrative court to have the loss assessed in damages . ... "
On DATE the mayor made the following reply :
As there has been no change in the staff of your grade working for the ORG , I can only confirm what I said in my previous letters .
I have no objection to your bringing this case before the administrative court .

CARDINAL . ORG On DATE Miss PERSON applied to ORG to have the mayor ’s decision confirming her " technical reinstatement " and her " leave of absence without pay " quashed and to obtain an order that he should pay her the salary she should have received from DATE .
CARDINAL . ORG The mayor filed pleadings on DATE and DATE and on DATE and CARDINAL DATE . The applicant did likewise on DATE and CARDINAL DATE and on CARDINAL DATE .
CARDINAL . ORG Following a hearing on DATE , the court delivered the following judgment on DATE :
With regard to Miss PERSON ’s technical reinstatement :

On the conditions laid down by the mayor of ORG Miss PERSON ’s reinstatement is a purely technical decision ; that being so , it is null and void . It is therefore necessary to set aside the decision of CARDINAL March CARDINAL in so far as it upholds the applicant ’s technical reinstatement .
With regard to Miss PERSON ’s right to reinstatement :

Under Article L. CARDINAL - CARDINAL of LAW as in force when the impugned decision was taken , ‘ A member of staff granted leave of absence at his own request shall be entitled to reinstatement by appointment to one of the first CARDINAL posts falling vacant where the leave has not exceeded CARDINAL years’ ...

The applicant claimed that CARDINAL posts she was suitably qualified for had fallen vacant and been filled during the period when she was requesting reinstatement and that CARDINAL posts had been created . The mayor of GPE asserted that , on the contrary , the posts provided for in the establishment table were filled and that no permanent staff had been recruited since DATE . That being so , the parties disagreed as to the facts . It is therefore necessary to order that further inquiries into the facts should be made , firstly to enable the mayor of GPE to produce all the documents necessary to determine the position since DATE regarding vacant posts and staff recruited in Miss PERSON ’s grade , and secondly so that the total salary the applicant would have received from DATE can be calculated .
CARDINAL . ORG The applicant filed pleadings on DATE , DATE and CARDINAL DATE . The mayor did likewise on DATE and DATE .
CARDINAL . ORG Through a member of parliament Miss PERSON asked the ombudsman to intervene and expedite the proceedings . The ombudsman replied on CARDINAL DATE that judgment had been given on DATE .
CARDINAL . ORG This judgment was served on the applicant on DATE . The court rejected her remaining submissions on the following ground :

It is clear from an examination of the case file , and in particular of the table of posts of shorthand typist produced by the mayor of GPE , that CARDINAL posts are provided for in the budget , while CARDINAL posts are occupied by permanent staff , a number that has not changed since DATE . All the staff in question were taken on DATE , when Miss PERSON applied to be reinstated . The fact that the post Miss PERSON occupied before she was granted leave of absence is vacant has no bearing on the lawfulness of the contested decision . Under these circumstances the applicant is not justified in maintaining that the rights she derived from her priority entitlement to be taken on again following her leave of absence have been infringed . Miss PERSON therefore can not claim compensation corresponding to her total salary since DATE .
CARDINAL . ORG On DATE Miss PERSON appealed against ORG CARDINAL judgments to the PERSON d’Etat . She filed a supplementary pleading on DATE .
CARDINAL . ORG In a letter of CARDINAL DATE Miss PERSON enquired of the secretary of ORG of the ORG d’Etat about the proceedings . The secretary replied on CARDINAL DATE :
" ... the case file ... is currently in the hands of the lawyer for ORG for inspection and has been since DATE , for DATE .
As soon as he returns it , it will be sent to your lawyer for your reply , for the same length of time .

As soon as the written proceedings in preparation of the case for trial have been completed , I will submit your case file to the presiding judge . It is nevertheless likely that this case will not be heard until DATE at the earliest .
CARDINAL . ORG filed a pleading on DATE , to which Miss PERSON replied on DATE .

CARDINAL . ORG In a letter of CARDINAL DATE the applicant made further enquiries of the secretary about the proceedings . The secretary replied on DATE that , as soon as the preparation of the case for trial had been completed , he had submitted the case file to the presiding judge of the Third Section , who had allocated it to a reporting judge in DATE .
CARDINAL . ORG filed a pleading on CARDINAL DATE .

CARDINAL . ORG On DATE Miss PERSON sent the secretary a letter - to which she received no reply - expressing her concern at the time it was taking to deal with her case and asking if she should write to the presiding judge to make him aware that her situation called for an early judgment .
CARDINAL . ORG The applicant ’s mother wrote to the secretary on DATE . She told him of the conflicting information her daughter had been given on the telephone by the registry
- the case file had apparently not yet been transferred to the Government Commissioner ( commissaire du gouvernement )
- and requested details of the proceedings and of what further could be done to speed them up .
The applicant ’s mother wrote again as follows on DATE after her daughter had received a copy of the latest pleading filed by ORG :

Given that preparation of the case for trial ended in DATE , [ my daughter ] can not understand why the opposing side should produce a further pleading and why this should be admitted to the case file when it had been stated that once the preparation of the case was terminated , no new document could be added .

I suppose that if the rules are to be applied , it would be simpler to withdraw this second pleading , which arrived undated DATE after termination of the preparation of the case , and for only the evidence already in the file to be submitted to the Government Commissioner appointed to study it .
CARDINAL . ORG The PERSON d’Etat held a hearing on DATE and gave judgment on DATE . It dismissed the appeal as follows :

Firstly , under the ... provisions of Article L. CARDINAL - CARDINAL of LAW , the mayor was not bound to reinstate Miss PERSON until the third vacancy arising after the end of her leave of absence . It appears from the evidence that DATE and DATE CARDINAL vacancies arose that Miss PERSON was suitably qualified to fill . ... the mayor of GPE ’s decision of CARDINAL March DATE whereby he refused Miss ORG ’s application for reinstatement was therefore not in breach of the provisions of Article L. CARDINAL - CARDINAL of LAW .

It is clear from all the foregoing that Miss PERSON is not justified in maintaining that ORG , having ordered in a judgment of DATE that further inquiries into the facts should be made ( a measure which , contrary to what the applicant maintained , was not obstructive ) , was wrong in its judgment of CARDINAL DATE to refuse her application to quash the decision of CARDINAL March CARDINAL .
CARDINAL . ORG The provisions of LAW that were applicable in the instant case
- they were repealed by PERSON no . CARDINAL - CARDINAL of DATE
- were the following :

" Leave of absence means that a member of staff is released from performing his normal duties and that , for the duration of such leave , his rights relating to promotion and retirement cease to accrue .
" Leave of absence shall be ordered in a decision by the mayor , either of his own motion or at the request of the person concerned . "
" Leave of absence may be granted at the request of a member of staff in the following circumstances only :
CARDINAL . For personal reasons ; in this case the leave may not exceed DATE but shall be renewable for DATE .
" A member of staff granted leave of absence at his own request shall not be entitled to any remuneration .

" A member of staff granted leave of absence at his own request shall be entitled to reinstatement by way of appointment to one of the first CARDINAL posts falling vacant where the leave has not exceeded DATE . "

CARDINAL . ORG A civil servant whose dismissal has been quashed as being unlawful is entitled to receive compensation for pecuniary damage , calculated on the basis of the salary lost ( PERSON d’Etat , DATE , ORG . CARDINAL ) .
